snippet: A courtroom was shown family photographs and video of trotting horses, but not the supposedly fabricated news videos that underlie the charges.
abstract: Prosecutors are unable to produce video footage that they say is the basis of their case against journalists Peter Greste, Mohamed Fadel Fahmy and Baher Mohamed; men, accused of conspiring with the Muslim Brotherhood to broadcast false reports about civil strife in Egypt, are ordered to return to jail until next court session, scheduled for April 22.
lead_paragraph: A courtroom was shown family photographs and video of trotting horses, but not the supposedly fabricated news videos that underlie the charges.

headline.main: Evidence Comes Up Short as Egypt Tries 3 Journalists
headline.print_headline: Evidence Comes Up Short as Egypt Tries 3 Journalists
